item.title: Staci add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I have nothing to declare except my genius." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Staci add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I like the scientific spirit—the holding off, the being sure but not too sure, the willingness to surrender ideas when the evidence is against them: this is ultimately fine—it always keeps the way beyond open—always gives life, thought, affection, the whole man, a chance to try over again after a mistake—after a wrong guess." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Staci add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Staci add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Staci add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Staci add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Staci add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Staci add a quote by Sylvia Beach
item.description: "I am a citizen of the world." -- Sylvia Beach
